job description:
Mission Bell is the premiere destination for architectural millwork in California; our work is on display in many Bay Area companies including Google, Kaiser Permanente, Facebook, LinkedIn and Stanford University. We are looking to add a Data Scientist as part of our tech-forward team. Under the direction of the Director of IT, the Data Scientist is primarily responsible for developing data models and creating business intelligence solutions.

If you are passionate about enhancing our data platform, creating business solutions, and utilizing creative ideas from analytics we invite you to apply to our newly opened Data Scientist position!

WHAT MISSION BELL BRINGS TO YOU:
  • Competitive pay
  • Rich benefits package
  • A growing IT department with opportunities for advancement
  • A community environment where your ideas are valued
WHAT OUR DATA SCIENTIST DOES:
  • Extend Mission Bells data collection by working with the in-house development team on custom applications or integrating third party applications
  • Process, clean, and verify the integrity of data used for analysis
  • Create and maintain a business intelligence solution layer
  • Work with business analysts across all business units to build ad-hoc queries and presentations
  • Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets and processes
  • Be a Mission Bell Innovator by constantly looking for opportunities to innovate and create new processes, ideas or products; innovation is the ability to recognize and stimulate unusual ideas with high potential impact
HERE'S WHAT YOU NEED:
  • Bachelors degree in related field such as IT or Computer Science
  • 3-5 years of experience in creating BI solutions or building statistical models
  • Proficiency in SQL and some experience with SQL Server 2016
  • Experience with statistical programming languages such as R or Python
  • Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau or D3.js
  • Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.) and experience with applications
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
